description: Launch Your Career in the Music Business. Success Begins with Creativity & Fundamentals in Entrepreneurship, Law, and Music Business Structure
learning_outcomes: Gain fundamental knowledge in music business structure, entrepreneurship, and law. Develop skills in copyright, revenue streams, marketing, and networking within the music industry.
prerequisites: Basic computer skills and an interest in the music industry are recommended.
price: Coursera subscription required
title: Music Business  Specialization

description: U.S. Federal Taxation of Individuals & Businesses. Learners will develop knowledge in U.S. federal taxation as applied to individuals and businesses.
learning_outcomes: Develop knowledge of U.S. federal taxation for individuals and businesses, covering tax law, federal tax returns, and depreciation.
prerequisites: Basic accounting principles or familiarity with business concepts is recommended.
price: Coursera subscription fee applies. Free audit option may be available.
title: U.S. Federal Taxation Specialization

description: Become fluent in the rules of the new economy. Learn how to use intellectual property law to protect and maximize the value of your innovations
learning_outcomes: Understand intellectual property law, protect innovations, maximize asset value, and navigate the legal landscape of the new economy. Develop strategies for intellectual property management.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business principles and legal concepts is helpful, but not required. No prior knowledge of intellectual property law is necessary.
price: Coursera offers a subscription-based model. The price varies depending on the subscription plan, but expect to pay around $49-$79 per month for access to the Specialization.
title: Intellectual Property Law Specialization

description: The Healthcare Law Specialization on Coursera provides a comprehensive understanding of the legal and ethical landscape of the healthcare industry. It covers key topics such as the Affordable Care Act (ACA), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), health policy, privacy regulations, and legal liability in healthcare settings. Participants will gain insights into healthcare management, health insurance, and the complexities of navigating the legal aspects of patient care and healthcare administration.
learning_outcomes: Understand the legal and ethical principles governing healthcare, including HIPAA and the ACA. Analyze health policies, manage healthcare within legal frameworks, and mitigate legal liabilities. Acquire skills in privacy and regulatory compliance.
prerequisites: A general understanding of the healthcare system or legal principles is helpful, but not required. An interest in health policy and law is recommended.
price: Coursera offers a subscription-based model for Specializations, with a free trial period. The price varies depending on the subscription duration; typically around $49-$79 per month.
skills: Health Insurance Portability And Accountability Act (HIPAA)
title: Healthcare Law Specialization

description: Learn how the Law Regulates the Cloud. Master the main legal and regulatory implications of using and providing cloud computing services.
learning_outcomes: Understand the legal and regulatory implications of cloud computing, covering areas like GDPR, cybersecurity, contract law, intellectual property, and international data transfers.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts or experience in the IT industry is recommended, but not required.
price: Coursera offers this Specialization through a subscription model. Prices vary depending on subscription length and region. Please check Coursera for specific pricing.
title: Cloud Computing Law Specialization

description: Build skills to improve health & save lives. Learn foundational building blocks of humanitarian program planning, implementation, and evaluation.
learning_outcomes: Gain skills in humanitarian program planning, implementation, and evaluation to improve health outcomes and save lives globally.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of health concepts; high school level science or biology recommended.
price: Coursera subscription fee applies. Free audit option may be available.
title: Foundations of Global Health Specialization

description: Launch your career in Europe. Master the essentials in European Business Law.
learning_outcomes: Master the essentials of European Business Law and gain skills to navigate the European market, enabling career advancement in Europe.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts and business principles recommended.
price: Varies based on Coursera subscription or individual course purchase.
title: European Business Law  Specialization

description: This course begins by exploring short term entry and long term entry into the United States. We will cover the various means of short term entry and long term entry, as well as the general application processes. We will also examine exclusion and deportation in the United States. In particular, we will discuss how and why individuals may not be admitted into the United States and possible reasons for deportation or removal. Lastly, we will cover the process of how to become a United States citizen and the various requirements for naturalization.
learning_outcomes: Understand short-term and long-term U.S. entry, application processes, exclusion/deportation reasons, and naturalization requirements. Learn about pathways to citizenship and the complexities of immigration law.
prerequisites: None - Basic understanding of legal concepts recommended
price: Free to audit; paid certificate available
title: Nuts and Bolts of U.S. Immigration Law

description: Launch your Career as a GST taxation executive. Build job-ready skills for an in-demand career as a GST professional in India. No prior experience required.
learning_outcomes: Build job-ready skills in GST. Understand GST law, compliance, return filing, e-invoicing, and reconciliation for a career as a GST professional in India.
prerequisites: No prior experience required, but basic computer literacy and a general interest in finance and taxation are helpful.
price: Coursera offers various subscription models; pricing details available on the Coursera website.
title: PwC GST Taxation Executive  Professional Certificate

description: American Contract Law I (along with its sister course Contracts II) provides a comprehensive overview of contract law in the United States. The course covers most of the key concepts found in a first year law school class. Each lecture is based on one or more common-law cases, integrating legal doctrines with policy discussions. The course also covers key sections from the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which governs the sale of goods.
learning_outcomes: Understand key concepts of contract law in the United States.
Analyze common-law cases and relevant legal doctrines.
Interpret key sections of the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC).
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts or equivalent intellectual maturity.
High School level reading comprehension.
price: Free
title: American Contract Law I

description: Being a successful FinTech firm requires more than just great technology; it also requires an understanding of the laws and regulations applicable to your business. This course will provide you with that understanding. You will learn about the critical legal, regulatory, and policy issues associated with cryptocurrencies, initial coin offerings, online lending, new payments and wealth management technologies, and financial account aggregators.  In addition, you will learn how regulatory agencies in the U.S. are continually adjusting to the emergence of new financial technologies and how one specific agency has proposed a path for FinTech firms to become regulated banks. You will also learn the basics of how banks are regulated in the U.S.
learning_outcomes: Understand critical legal, regulatory, and policy issues in FinTech. Learn about cryptocurrencies, online lending, payments, wealth management, and bank regulations. Analyze how agencies adjust to new financial technologies and potential paths for FinTech firms' regulation.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of financial markets
Interest in technology and innovation
Familiarity with business principles (optional)
price: Paid
title: FinTech Law and Policy

description: About this Course
learning_outcomes: Understand the intersection of AI and Law, potential applications, ethical considerations, and policy implications. Explore the legal challenges and opportunities presented by AI technologies.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal principles or AI concepts is helpful but not mandatory.
price: Free to audit, paid certificate available
title: AI & Law

description: ‘The Arbitration of International Disputes’ is the third course of Leiden University’s  series on International Law in Action. The first course covered generalities on the international courts and tribunals in The Hague, while the second course provided an insider's  perspective into the work of international criminal courts and tribunals.  This third course explores the major aspects of international arbitration as one of the most common method of international dispute settlement . Through this course you will gain an in-depth understanding of the  various facets of international arbitration through the analysis of its role as a mechanism of dispute settlement, its institutions, the fields of law it is applicable to, and, of course, its most famous awards.
learning_outcomes: Gain an in-depth understanding of international arbitration as a dispute settlement mechanism, including its institutions, applicable laws, and famous awards, through detailed analysis.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of international law concepts recommended but not required.
price: Free to audit; certificate available for a fee
title: International Law in Action: the Arbitration of International Disputes

description: This course will give you a glimpse into six different areas of American law: Tort Law, Contract Law, Property, Constitutional Law, Criminal Law, and Civil Procedure. You will gain insight into the complexities and dilemmas that arise from the application of law in different settings, and what is distinctive about American approaches.
learning_outcomes: Understand core areas of American law: tort, contract, property, constitutional, criminal, and civil procedure. Gain insight into complexities and dilemmas in applying law and distinctive American approaches.
prerequisites: None; an interest in law and legal systems is beneficial.
price: Free to audit, paid for certificate
title: An Introduction to American Law

description: This class deals with the business law topics that appear on the CPA exam: Agency, Contracts, Debtor-Creditor Relationships, Government Regulation of Business, and Business Organizations. Students will gain an understanding of how these areas of the law affect businesses and their operations, with an eye on preparation for the business law portions of the REG section of the CPA exam. By the end of the class, students will be able to identify the legal principles that govern various business situations and apply those principles to an issue to determine the outcome when the law is applied to the facts of a scenario.
learning_outcomes: Students will be able to identify legal principles governing business situations and apply them to determine outcomes. The course also prepares students for the business law portions of the REG section of the CPA exam.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business concepts
High school diploma or equivalent
Interest in business law and CPA exam preparation
price: Free to audit, paid for certificate
title: Corporate & Commercial Law I: Contracts & Employment Law

description: Whether you are an advanced law student looking to review the basics, or an aspiring law student looking for head start, this course will help you build the foundation you will need to succeed in law school and beyond. This course will introduce you to terminology, concepts, and tools lawyers and legal academics use to make their arguments. It will help you follow these arguments—and make arguments of your own.
learning_outcomes: Students will learn legal terminology, concepts, and tools used by lawyers and legal academics. They will be able to follow legal arguments and construct their own legal arguments effectively.
prerequisites: Basic reading comprehension
Interest in law or legal studies
price: Free to audit, paid certificate available
title: A Law Student's Toolkit

description: “International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice” is the first MOOC of the Kalshoven-Gieskes Forum on International Humanitarian Law, which is the platform within the Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies of Leiden University for the research, teaching and dissemination of international humanitarian law (IHL).
learning_outcomes: Understand the principles and application of International Humanitarian Law (IHL). Learn about the legal framework governing armed conflicts and the protection of individuals in war.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts or international relations is helpful, but not required.
price: Free to audit. Certificate available for a fee.
title: International Humanitarian Law in Theory and Practice

description: Environmental law may be the one institution standing between us and planetary exhaustion. It is also an institution that needs to be reconciled with human liberty and economic aspirations. This course considers these issues and provides a tour though existing legal regimes governing pollution, water law, endangered species, toxic substances, environmental impact analyses, and environmental risk.
learning_outcomes: Understand legal regimes governing pollution, water law, endangered species, toxic substances, environmental impact analyses, and risk. Reconcile environmental law with human liberty and economic goals.
prerequisites: None. Basic understanding of social sciences or current events is helpful.
price: Free to audit; certificate available for a fee
title: Introduction to Environmental Law and Policy

description: The common law of England and Wales is one of the major global legal traditions.
learning_outcomes: Understand the core principles of English Common Law. Learn about its history and development and how it shapes modern legal systems. Analyze case studies and apply legal reasoning.
prerequisites: None - Assumes no prior legal knowledge.
price: Free to audit, paid for certificate
title: Introduction to English Common Law

description: Delve into the research behind terrorism as you unpack the assumptions and impacts of both terrorism and counterterrorism.
learning_outcomes: Understand terrorism research, assess assumptions about terrorism, and analyze the impacts of both terrorism and counterterrorism strategies. Develop critical thinking about global security issues.
prerequisites: A general interest in political science or international relations is helpful, but no specific prior knowledge is required.
price: Free to audit, paid certificate available
title: Terrorism and Counterterrorism: Comparing Theory and Practice

description: Reducing Gun Violence in America: Evidence for Change is designed to provide learners with the best available science and insights from top scholars across the country as well as the skills to understand which interventions are the most effective to offer a path forward for reducing gun violence in our homes, schools, and communities.
learning_outcomes: Learners will understand the science behind gun violence, identify effective interventions, and gain insights into policy changes that can reduce gun violence in communities and homes.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of social science concepts is helpful, but not required. An interest in public health and policy is recommended.
price: Free to audit. Paid certificate available.
title: Reducing Gun Violence in America: Evidence for Change

description: Drawing on the contributions of several academic disciplines including law, psychology, sociology, history, educational and health sciences, economy and anthropology, an interdisciplinary approach guides the student into a selection of critical issues concerning children’s rights. Participants will gain insight relative to the development of this specific human rights category, as well as to the evolution of the challenges faced by children over time and society’s efforts to respond. Successful international strategies and programs promoting children’s rights will be highlighted, as well as the role of key actors involved in international organizations working in this field. This open online course provides an overview of the most important features of children’s human rights. A central portion of the MOOC will consist of a presentation of the international and regional standards on children’s rights and the related international and regional judicial and quasi-judicial bodies designed to ensure their implementation.
learning_outcomes: Gain insight into the development of children’s rights, understand challenges faced by children, and analyze international strategies and programs. Learn about international standards and related judicial bodies.
prerequisites: None. An interest in social sciences, law, or human rights is helpful but not required.
price: Free to audit. Paid certificate available.
title: Children's Human Rights - An Interdisciplinary Introduction

description: Dyslexia is everywhere, touching so many children and adults, and while science has made extraordinary progress in understanding and clarifying the condition, this incredible powerful knowledge rarely reaches those who most need to know and would greatly benefit from it. Our goal is to change all this with the Coursera you are about to view, produced by Dr. Sally Shaywitz, the Audrey G. Ratner Professor in Learning Development, both the leading scientist studying dyslexia and the most devoted advocate for helping those who are dyslexic.
learning_outcomes: Gain insights into the science behind dyslexia, understand its impact on children and adults, and learn how to apply research-backed knowledge to support individuals with dyslexia.
prerequisites: None, though a basic understanding of education or child development would be helpful.
price: Free to audit; certificate available for a fee
title: Overcoming Dyslexia

description: Vast amounts of personal information are processed in the cloud. But who is legally responsible for such ‘personal data’ in cloud environments? What duties do cloud providers like Amazon, Microsoft, and Google have? And what rights can you, as an individual, exercise under data protection law? If you’d like to find out, then this course is for you!
learning_outcomes: Understand legal responsibilities for personal data in cloud environments. Learn the duties of cloud providers and individual rights under data protection law.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of internet concepts and data privacy is recommended, but not required.
price: Coursera offers courses with a free audit option. Paid enrollment may be required for graded assignments and certificates.
title: Cloud Computing Law: Data Protection and Cybersecurity

description: About this Course
learning_outcomes: Understand EU competition law framework, including antitrust and merger regulations. Learn to apply these principles to real-world business scenarios and develop strategies for competing effectively in the European market.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business principles
Interest in international law or economics
Familiarity with legal concepts (recommended)
price: Free to audit; Paid certificate available
title: European Business Law: Competing in Europe

description: In this course taught by E. Michael Harrington, students will learn the basis for copyright including what is and is not covered by copyright law. This course will help clarify what rights artists have as creators as well as what the public is free to take from their work. Students will also learn what to do if someone copies their work and what to do if they are accused of copying someone else. Finally, the course will discuss how technology has changed copyright for the better (and worse) and how copyright laws may change in the coming years.
learning_outcomes: Understand copyright basics, artist rights, fair use, and legal actions for infringement. Analyze technology's impact on copyright and future changes in copyright laws within the music industry.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of the music industry is helpful, but not required. No prior legal knowledge is necessary.
price: Coursera courses often have a free audit option. A subscription or one-time payment is required for graded assignments and a certificate.
skills: Leverage the copyright law to your advantage
title: Copyright Law in the Music Business

description: In our modern technologically-based economy, the creation and enforcement of patent rights can make or break a business. With record numbers of patents being issued every year, the stakes for inventors (and, indeed, their lawyers) continue to rise, even as the patent law and its administration faces growing criticism.
learning_outcomes: Understand patent rights, their creation, and enforcement in a technologically-based economy. Learn about the rising stakes for inventors and lawyers amidst patent law criticism.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business or technology is helpful, but not required. No prior legal knowledge is necessary.
price: Coursera offers courses with options to audit for free, or pay for a certificate.
title: Patent Law

description: The European Union is one of the world’s largest and most important economies. This six week course is the first in a series of three that will provide students with an insight into European Business Law. The series ranges from considering the basic structures and principles of the European Union to focusing on various specialized areas of law. Each course will give the students an understanding of the laws and policies that regulate the internal market of European Union, as well as relevant case law and useful inputs from leading practitioners in the field.
learning_outcomes: Understand the structures and principles of the European Union, the laws regulating its internal market, and relevant case law. Gain insights from leading practitioners in European Business Law.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business concepts; familiarity with legal frameworks is helpful but not required.
price: Coursera offers a free audit option. A subscription is required for graded assignments and a certificate.
title: European Business Law: Understanding the Fundamentals

description: This course begins with an overview of general intellectual property law in the United States, then examines how the policy choices behind those laws shapes the behavior of major players in the healthcare industry. We will examine how patents and trademarks shape the behavior of pharmaceutical companies, and how complex issues involving medical research in university settings, and ownership of genetic information and material, are resolved by intellectual property laws. The course concludes with in-depth case studies of an international pharmaceutical company, a major medical device company, and a start-up in the emerging DNA-testing industry.
learning_outcomes: Understand intellectual property law in the US healthcare industry. Learn how patents and trademarks affect pharmaceutical companies. Examine legal issues related to medical research, genetic information, and case studies of healthcare companies.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts
Interest in healthcare industry
Familiarity with intellectual property is helpful but not required
price: Paid
title: Intellectual Property in the Healthcare Industry

description: Have you ever wondered what’s in the small print of cloud contracts? Or who owns the information you upload to the cloud? And who can access and control it? If so, then this course is for you! You’ll learn to identify the legal risks involved in cloud computing transactions - and to suggest possible solutions.
learning_outcomes: Identify legal risks in cloud transactions, understand data ownership and control in the cloud, and propose solutions to mitigate legal challenges.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts and familiarity with cloud computing principles is recommended.
price: Course is typically part of a Coursera subscription or can be purchased individually.
title: Cloud Computing Law: Transactions

description: Copyright law is unique in the greater intellectual property regime, as it protects original expression that is fixed in a tangible medium and is the product of authorship.  This course is designed for creative professionals — such as screenwriters, musicians, documentary filmmakers or artists — who want to understand the scope and limits of which works can enjoy U.S. copyright protection. The course will introduce students to the workings of copyright law through an examination of the system’s basic principles, rules, and institutions. Topics will include; the justifications for copyright law, copyrightable subject matter, authorship, the nature and scope of copyright’s exclusive rights, fair use, and remedies for infringement.
learning_outcomes: Understand copyright law's basic principles, rules, and institutions. Learn about copyrightable subject matter, authorship, exclusive rights, fair use, and infringement remedies in the U.S.
prerequisites: None, but an interest in creative works and intellectual property is helpful.
price: Free to audit; paid certificate available.
title: Copyright Law

description: What does it take to comply with privacy laws?
learning_outcomes: Understand privacy laws, including HIPAA, and their implications. Learn to comply with legal requirements and protect sensitive information. Identify potential liabilities.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal and ethical principles. Familiarity with healthcare systems is helpful but not required.
price: Coursera Plus subscription or individual course purchase.
title: Privacy Law and HIPAA

description: This course, Public Health in Humanitarian Crises 1, introduces discussions about the public health approach to problems experienced by people affected by disasters, both natural and related to conflict. The course discusses the many changes which occur in people’s lives when they are uprooted by a disaster, ranging from changes in disease patterns, access to health care, livelihoods, shelter, sanitary conditions, nutritional status, etceteras. We will explore what humanitarian interventions could look like if we want to mitigate the effects of disasters. The course content is a mix of theoretical knowledge and many practical examples from recent disasters. We think this course is unique because it contains so many practical ‘real-life’ examples and is taught by instructors and guest lecturers who together have over 200 years of experience in this field.
learning_outcomes: Understand the public health approach to humanitarian crises. Learn about the changes in health, livelihoods, and living conditions caused by disasters. Explore effective humanitarian interventions.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of public health concepts or related field is helpful but not required.
price: Free to audit; certificate available for a fee
title: Public Health in Humanitarian Crises 1

description: In this course taught by E. Michael Harrington, students will learn the basis for copyright including what is and is not covered by copyright law. This course will help clarify what rights artists have as creators as well as what the public is free to take from their work. Students will also learn what to do if someone copies their work and what to do if they are accused of copying someone else. Finally, the course will discuss how technology has changed copyright for the better (and worse) and how copyright laws may change in the coming years.
skills: Leverage the copyright law to your advantage
title: Copyright Law in the Music Business

description: Have you ever wondered how a police officer in Europe can obtain evidence from a cloud provider in the USA? Or whether a major cloud provider might abuse its market power? Or in which countries cloud providers pay taxes? If so, then this course is for you!
title: Cloud Computing Law: Law Enforcement, Competition, & Tax

description: Intellectual property is the currency of the tech world, with the world’s most valuable intellectual property assets dwarfing the value of their real-world counterparts. Apple’ trademarked brand was valued at over $100 billion as of 2017. J.K. Rowling’s Harry potter franchise has generated over $25 billion to date. But how did the law come to create such enormous value in intangible assets?
learning_outcomes: Understand the fundamental principles of intellectual property law. Learn how trademarks, copyrights, and patents create value. Explore the legal framework behind intangible assets and their economic impact.
prerequisites: No prior legal knowledge is required. Basic understanding of business concepts is helpful.
price: Free to audit, paid certificate available
title: Introduction to Intellectual Property

description: The protections afforded under trademark law have created incredible value in intangible assets, with the value of the world’s most valuable brands such as Amazon, Apple and Google each exceeding $100 billion. But what exactly is trademark law, and how is such enormous value created?
title: Trademark Law

description: This course serves as an introduction to the physics of electricity and magnetism.  Upon completion, learners will have an understanding of how the forces between electric charges are described by fields, and how these fields are related to electrical circuits. They will gain experience in solving physics problems with tools such as graphical analysis, algebra, vector analysis, and calculus.  The course follows the typical progression of topics of a first-semester university physics course:  charges, electric forces, electric fields potential, magnetic fields, currents, magnetic moments, electromagnetic induction, and circuits.  Each module contains reading links to a free textbook, complete video lectures, conceptual quizzes, and a set of homework problems.  Once the modules are completed, the course ends with an exam.  This comprehensive course series is similar in detail and rigor to what is taught on-campus.  It will thoroughly prepare learners for their upcoming introductory physics courses, or more advanced courses in physics.
learning_outcomes: Understand forces between electric charges via fields and their relation to electrical circuits. Solve physics problems using graphical analysis, algebra, vector analysis, and calculus.
prerequisites: Algebra, basic calculus, and introductory physics concepts recommended.
price: Paid
title: Physics 102  - Magnetic Fields and Faraday's Law

description: What does it take to comply with privacy laws?
learning_outcomes: Understand privacy laws, data protection principles, compliance requirements, and risk management strategies for handling personal data responsibly.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of legal concepts and business operations recommended.
price: Paid
title: Privacy Law and Data Protection

description: More than one century after the Wright brothers' first flight, the flight still defy our intuition. You will learn here how to name the different parts of the airplane and how to describe and quantify its geometry. For that, we need now to share a precise vocabulary to describe the airplane's movement and attitude in space, and a refresher on basic general mechanic principles. You will remind how Newton's 2nd law allows you to determine what force must be applied on an apple - or on an airplane, to modify the magnitude and direction of its speed. Coming back on the concepts of kinetic energy and potential energy, you will discover the very useful concept of total height and you will be able to explain how an airplane can quickly exchange speed for altitude, while changes in total height are much slower.
title: Flight mechanics - The basis

description: Professional epidemiologists are often called on to investigate outbreaks and epidemics. This course serves as an introduction to the essentials of investigation, identifying pathogens, figuring out what's going on, reporting, and responding. You'll learn how to ask precise epidemiologic questions and apply epidemiologic tools to uncover the answers. You'll also learn about basic epidemic dynamics and the terrible law that cause them to grow, as well as the reasons why they recede and eventually go away. The course concludes with deep dives into some real outbreaks from Ebola, in West Africa, to the opioid epidemic in the United States.
learning_outcomes: Learn to investigate outbreaks, identify pathogens, apply epidemiologic tools, and understand epidemic dynamics. Analyze real-world outbreaks like Ebola and the opioid epidemic.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of biology and statistics is recommended. No prior epidemiology experience is required.
price: Coursera offers courses through subscriptions or individual purchase.
title: Outbreaks and Epidemics

description: This six-week course titled Doing Business in Europe is the second in a series of three exploring some of the main business aspects of European Union law. Besides providing learners with a sound knowledge base of European laws and regulations relevant to establishing and managing a company within the European Union, the course also explores business considerations within a broader perspective by including inputs from leading law practitioners in the field. More specifically, the course discusses strategic and financial considerations within Company law, as well as Labour law issues such as restructuring enterprises, working conditions and handling crises situations. The course also examines other legal areas such as Tax law, Environmental law and Private International law, and how they tie in to doing business in Europe.
title: European Business Law: Doing Business in Europe

description: This course explores how statutes, regulations, common law, and market forces help or hinder three major goals of policy makers: increasing access, reducing cost, and improving quality. We will examine the Supreme Court’s rulings on the ACA and other legal aspects of modern health care reform. Learners who successfully complete this course will be able to describe the laws, regulations, common law and market forces that shape our health care system and identify areas where ideas and innovation are needed; explain the malpractice system and how it influences medical practice; and analyze legal aspects of the ACA.
learning_outcomes: Describe the laws, regulations, and market forces shaping the U.S. healthcare system. Explain the malpractice system's influence on medical practice. Analyze legal aspects of the Affordable Care Act (ACA).
prerequisites: A general interest in healthcare and U.S. policy is recommended. No prior legal knowledge is strictly required.
price: Coursera offers a free audit option. A subscription is required for graded assignments and a certificate.
title: U.S. Health Law Fundamentals

description: The European Union is one of the world's largest and most important economies. This specialization is a 3-course bundle that will teach learners the fundamentals of European Business Law.
learning_outcomes: Understand fundamentals of European Business Law. Learn about regulations, compliance, intellectual property, tax laws, and competitive analysis within the EU context.
prerequisites: Basic understanding of business principles is helpful, but not required. No prior legal knowledge necessary.
price: Coursera offers a free trial. After the trial, a subscription is required to access course materials and earn a certificate. Subscription costs vary.
title: European Business Law Specialization
